alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:24PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, central Orleans and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 223 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflows along a line extending from near Shell Beach to 8 miles southeast of Poydras to 7 miles northeast of Myrtle Grove. Movement was north at 35 mph. These outflows will trigger additional storms in the area, which will be capable of wind gusts near 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Belle Chasse, Chalmette, Lake Catherine, Violet, Meraux and Poydras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
